alert.note: Alert for Costilla; Huerfano; Las Animas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 08 at 11:11AM MST until December 08 at 11:45AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Huerfano County in southeastern Colorado... Northeastern Costilla County in south central Colorado... Western Las Animas County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 1145 AM MST. * At 1110 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160 to Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county to 7 miles east of Fort Garland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Highway 160 over La Veta Pass. Locations impacted include... Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar, Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county, La Veta, La Veta Pass, and Spanish Peaks. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
